summary: The document details a covert employment arrangement for an individual, known as 'Subject', under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It involves the creation of a fabricated company, 'Roberts Electronic and Engineering Service', to provide consulting services in electronics. This setup includes a comprehensive backstopped cover with employment references, payment methods, and specific instructions for handling tax documentation to maintain the covert status of the employment.
key_findings: The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It describes a covert employment arrangement for an individual, including a fabricated company and job description.
Instructions are provided for handling tax documentation to avoid revealing the covert nature of the employment.
The arrangement includes mechanisms for employment verification and payment to maintain the cover.
The document emphasizes the need for proper backstopping to ensure the cover's integrity.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
